texts.definition: The Discard Pile is the area or stack where cards or tiles are placed after they have been used.
description: The use of [Discard Piles](discard-piles) is common in all games that use cards.
usage: [Discard Piles](discard-piles) can be either closed or opened. Closed [Discard Piles](discard-piles) hide the important information of the game elements in them and do not let the players go through the piles. These piles can be used to provide an advantage of [Memorizing](memorizing) (with the most famous example being the cards played in games such as "Blackjack"). Open [Discard Piles](discard-piles), by contrast, either place the game elements so that they can all be seen or allow the players to go through the pile. These open piles support [Stimulated Planning](stimulated-planning) but may also cause [Analysis Paralysis](analysis-paralysis) since they allow players a more complete view of the game state.

[Discard Piles](discard-piles) make possible a certain kind of [Privileged Ability](privileged-abilities): going through the [Discard Pile](discard-piles) and taking, or directly using, one of the items in the pile.
consequences: The most basic function of [Discard Piles](discard-piles) is purely bureaucratic: it defines a place where to place the used game elements. However, the size of the [Discard Pile](discard-piles) allows players to judge the progress of the game.

[Discard Piles](discard-piles) are often combined with [Drawing Stacks](drawing-stacks) to create a [Closed Economy](closed-economies) of cards or tiles; when the [Drawing Stack](drawing-stacks) is depleted, a new is created by shuffling all the game elements in the [Discard Pile](discard-piles) and making it the new [Drawing Stack](drawing-stacks).
